original_solution_mapping.L1: At a 10 percent discount, Jordyn will pay 10/100%*$5=$.50 less for a bag of cherries.
original_solution_mapping.L2: To buy one of the cherries at a 10% discount Jordyn will pay $5-$0.50=$<<5-0.5=4.50>>4.50
original_solution_mapping.L3: The cost of buying 50 bags of cherries at the 10% discount is 50*4.50=$<<50*4.50=225>>225
original_solution_mapping.L4: Also, at a 10% discount, Jordyn will pay 10/100*$7=$<<10/100*7=0.70>>0.70 less for a bag of olives.
original_solution_mapping.L5: The price of a bag of olives at a 10% discount is $7-$0.70=$<<7-0.7=6.3>>6.3
original_solution_mapping.L6: To buy 50 bags of olives Jordyn will pay $6.3*50=$<<6.3*50=315>>315
original_solution_mapping.L7: The total cost of buying 50 bags of each fruit at a 10% discount is $315+$225=$540

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6049.
    Returns: the total cost for Jordyn to buy 50 bags of each fruit with a 10% discount.
    """
    # L1
    discount_percent_num = 10 # 10% discount
    percent_divisor = 100 # WK
    cherry_price_initial = 5 # $5 when the price of a bag of olives is $7
    cherry_discount_amount = (discount_percent_num / percent_divisor) * cherry_price_initial

    # L2
    cherry_price_discounted_per_bag = cherry_price_initial - cherry_discount_amount

    # L3
    num_bags_each_fruit = 50 # buying 50 bags of each fruit
    total_cost_cherries = num_bags_each_fruit * cherry_price_discounted_per_bag

    # L4
    olive_price_initial = 7 # $7
    olive_discount_amount = (discount_percent_num / percent_divisor) * olive_price_initial

    # L5
    olive_price_discounted_per_bag = olive_price_initial - olive_discount_amount

    # L6
    total_cost_olives = olive_price_discounted_per_bag * num_bags_each_fruit

    # L7
    total_cost_both_fruits = total_cost_olives + total_cost_cherries

    # FA
    answer = total_cost_both_fruits
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: At a {discount_percent_num} percent discount, Jordyn will pay {discount_percent_num}/{percent_divisor}%*${cherry_price_initial}=${cherry_discount_amount} less for a bag of cherries.

To buy one of the cherries at a 10% discount Jordyn will pay ${cherry_price_initial}-${cherry_discount_amount}=<<{cherry_price_initial}-{cherry_discount_amount}={cherry_price_discounted_per_bag}>>{cherry_price_discounted_per_bag}

The cost of buying {num_bags_each_fruit} bags of cherries at the 10% discount is {num_bags_each_fruit}*{cherry_price_discounted_per_bag}=<<{num_bags_each_fruit}*{cherry_price_discounted_per_bag}={total_cost_cherries}>>{total_cost_cherries}

Also, at a 10% discount, Jordyn will pay {discount_percent_num}/{percent_divisor}*${olive_price_initial}=<<{discount_percent_num}/{percent_divisor}*{olive_price_initial}={olive_discount_amount}>>{olive_discount_amount} less for a bag of olives.

The price of a bag of olives at a 10% discount is ${olive_price_initial}-${olive_discount_amount}=<<{olive_price_initial}-{olive_discount_amount}={olive_price_discounted_per_bag}>>{olive_price_discounted_per_bag}

To buy {num_bags_each_fruit} bags of olives Jordyn will pay ${olive_price_discounted_per_bag}*{num_bags_each_fruit}=<<{olive_price_discounted_per_bag}*{num_bags_each_fruit}={total_cost_olives}>>{total_cost_olives}
The total cost of buying 50 bags of each fruit at a 10% discount is ${total_cost_olives}+${total_cost_cherries}=${total_cost_both_fruits}

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'cherry_price_initial' (value: 5) was used instead of 'olive_discount_amount' (value: 0.7000000000000001).
